parameter 1: In 2011 'Albert Pyun' (qv) released the alternate cut of 'Cyborg' on DVD through his website. It is edited by Pyun and contains some previously unseen scenes that were cut from the film to earn a "R" rating rather than an "X".
parameter 2: The German VHS Version is only 92 Minutes long.
parameter 3: In 2011 'Albert Pyun' (qv) released the alternate cut of 'Cyborg' on DVD through his website. It is edited by Pyun and contains some previously unseen scenes that were cut from the film to earn a "R" rating rather than an "X".
parameter 4: The German VHS Version is only 92 Minutes long.
parameter 5: The UK release is cut by 4 secs by the BBFC to edit a shot of 'hedge shears being applied to a breast in a sexualized context'.
parameter 7: The American video release features different music during the epilogue, due to copyright problems. In the theatrical prints, Pink Floyd 's "If" is used.
parameter 9: The UK video version was heavily cut by 3 minutes and 15 seconds, to remove high amounts of violence and imitable techniques that were considered too extreme for an '18' rating. These included numerous edits to punches, kicks, neck breaks, a hand severing, a pole being rammed into a man's mouth and shots of a blade concealed in a man's boot. In 2000 all previous cuts were waived by the BBFC and in the same year TCF released the uncut film on DVD.
parameter 11: In 2011 'Albert Pyun' (qv) released the alternate cut of 'Cyborg' on DVD through his website. It is edited by Pyun and contains some previously unseen scenes that were cut from the film to earn a "R" rating rather than an "X".
parameter 13: The German DVD Version has a running time of 80 minutes.
parameter 14: The 1995 UK Imperial video was cut by 1 second by the BBFC to remove a neck break. This was restored in the Prism DVD release.
